item.title: Nvidia, AMD may sell high-end AI chips to China if they pay US a cut
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The global AI chip race narrative used to be about U.S. national security, but apparently now it's about tariffs: Nvidia and AMD have agreed to pay the U.S. government 15% of the revenue they make from sales of high-end AI chips to China in exchange for licenses to sell to those chips in the country, the Financial Times reported, citing anonymous sources.

item.title: Apple’s new Siri may allow users to operate apps just using voice
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Apple is testing a version of Siri that will be able to take actions on your behalf across various apps by following voice commands. The company plans to release a new version of App Intents, its framework gives developers the ability to allow users access to parts of their app via different systems, like search and Shortcuts.

item.title: Nigerian profitable food delivery Chowdeck lands $9M from Novastar, Y Combinator
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Chowdeck, a Lagos-based food delivery startup that has stayed profitable in a notoriously tough and low-margin market, has raised $9 million in Series A funding to launch a quick commerce strategy and expand into more cities in Nigeria and Ghana. The equity round was led by Novastar Ventures, with participation from Y Combinator, AAIC Investment, […]

item.title: Security flaws in a carmaker’s web portal let one hacker remotely unlock cars from anywhere
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Security researcher Eaton Zveare told TechCrunch that the flaws he discovered in the carmaker's centralized dealer portal exposed vast access to customer and vehicle data. With this access, Zveare said he could remotely take over a customer's account and unlock their cars, and more.

item.title: Why investors just bet $85M on this Indian company’s generic drug strategy
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Truemeds has taken a different route from other Indian online pharmacies — and it has helped the startup double its revenue.

item.title: The hidden cost of living in Mark Zuckerberg’s $110M compound
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg has spent 14 years gobbling up his leafy Palo Alto neighborhood, according to a New York Times report that details how the Meta CEO has purchased 11 properties for over $110 million to create his own personal fiefdom in Crescent Park. The piecemeal compound features a main residence, guest homes, manicured gardens, and […]

item.title: The computer science dream has become a nightmare
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The coding-equals-prosperity promise has officially collapsed. Fresh computer science graduates are facing unemployment rates of 6.1% to 7.5% — more than double what biology and art history majors are experiencing, according to a recent Federal Reserve Bank of New York study. A crushing New York Times piece highlights what’s happening on the ground. The individual […]

item.title: Stanford sticks with legacy admissions
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Stanford University has confirmed its admissions policies for fall 2026 will continue considering legacy status, a decision that could influence access to one of Silicon Valley’s most important talent pipelines. Stanford is also ending its test-optional policy, requiring SAT or ACT scores for the first time since 2021. According to the Stanford Daily, the university […]

item.title: After researchers unmasked a prolific SMS scammer, a new operation has emerged in its wake
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Security researchers are now sounding the alarm on a new SMS text message fraud operation, which is surging in popularity — and its ability to steal people's credit cards — since the demise of its predecessor.

item.title: Impersonators are targeting companies with fake TechCrunch outreach
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Staff
item.description: Fraudsters are impersonating TechCrunch reporters and event leads, and reaching out to companies. Here's what we're doing about it, and what you can look out for.

item.title: Sam Altman addresses ‘bumpy’ GPT-5 rollout, bringing 4o back, and the ‘chart crime’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The Reddit AMA got spicy as users peppered OpenAI with questions, and some asked the company to bring back its previous model.

item.title: RIP, Microsoft Lens, a simple little app that’s getting replaced by AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Microsoft is killing Lens, a handy mobile scanning app with over 90 million downloads.

item.title: Former Googlers’ AI startup OpenArt now creates ‘brain rot’ videos in just one click
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: OpenArt launched a new feature to help creators make AI-generated brain rot videos.

item.title: Don’t let your competitor steal the brand spotlight — secure your exhibit table at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: For 20 years, startups have come to TechCrunch Disrupt to meet their first investors, land their biggest partnerships, and spark the idea that takes them to the next level.

item.title: NASA and Google are building an AI medical assistant to keep Mars-bound astronauts healthy
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: The multimodal tool, which includes speech, text, and images, runs inside Google Cloud’s Vertex AI environment.

item.title: How to use Instagram Map and protect your privacy
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Following concerns about safety, Instagram head Adam Mosseri reassured users that the feature is opt-in, and noted that some people are “confused” about how the feature works.

item.title: Pinterest CEO says agentic shopping is still a long way out
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Pinterest CEO Bill Ready talks about the agentic web and where the social network will fit in the AI era.

item.title: OpenAI priced GPT-5 so low, it may spark a price war
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Developers who have had early access are touting GPT-5's pricing as much better than competing models.

item.title: SoftBank reportedly bought Foxconn’s Ohio factory for the Stargate AI project
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Foxconn spent years promising electric vehicles would be built at the former Chevy Cruze factory. Now it will make AI servers.

item.title: What founders need to know before choosing their exit — straight from Jai Das and Roseanne Wincek — at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Hear from Jai Das, Sapphire Ventures, and Roseanne Wincek, Renegade Partners, on how founders can prep for an exit at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025. Register here.
